fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data

Interface IListStructure

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IArrayData, IFetchable, IIntersection, ISource

    public interface IListStructure
    Defines the basic API for creating filter criteria, sort criteria, and range criteria, as required when fetching lists of elements.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IFilterBuilder buildFilter()
      Creates a filter builder for filtering data provided by this list structure.
      IRangeBuilder buildRange()
      Creates a range builder for paging navigation and optimized data fetching.
      ISortBuilder buildSort()
      Creates a sort builder for sorting data provided by this list structure.
      default IRange createRange(long first, long last)
      Creates an immutable range definition that can be applied to this list structure.
      default ISort createSort(Order order, ICell... cells)
      Creates an immutable unidirectional sort definition that can be applied to this list structure.

    • Method Detail

      • buildFilter

        IFilterBuilder buildFilter()
        Creates a filter builder for filtering data provided by this list structure. The most common filters are logical (boolean algebra) filters and search (full-text) filters.
        Returns:
        a new instance of a filter builder object that can be converted to an immutable filter.
        Since:
        1.0

      • buildSort

        ISortBuilder buildSort()
        Creates a sort builder for sorting data provided by this list structure.
        Returns:
        a new instance of a sort builder object that can be converted to an immutable sort definition.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        createSort(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.sort.Order, ICell...)

      • buildRange

        IRangeBuilder buildRange()
        Creates a range builder for paging navigation and optimized data fetching.
        Returns:
        a new instance of a range builder object that can be converted to an immutable range definition.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        createRange(long, long)

      • createRange

        default IRange createRange(long first,
                           long last)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an immutable range definition that can be applied to this list structure. The first and last parameters define (inclusively) the index positions of the first and last items to include. If a filter or sorting rules are applied, these aspects can change the selection of items that will match the range.
        Parameters:
        first - index position of the first item to include, not less than zero.
        last - index position of the last item to include, not less than the first index.
        Returns:
        a new record range.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the last index is less than the first index, or if either argument is less than zero.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        buildRange()

      • createSort

        default ISort createSort(Order order,
                         ICell... cells)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an immutable unidirectional sort definition that can be applied to this list structure. Sorting priority is defined by the order in which cells are added. Attempting to add a cell that has already been added has no effect on the sort being built (such attempts are ignored).

        All cells are sorted in the same order: for more flexibility, use a sort builder.

        Parameters:
        order - the sorting order.
        cells - one or more non-null cells to add. They can be from any source with which this list structure can be joined or merged when building a list.
        Returns:
        this sort builder, to continue adding sortable cells or to convert to an immutable sort definition object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the cell or order may not be used in the context of this data source.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        buildSort()
